tweet: Thank you to @SenatorRomney, @SenRubioPress, and @RepDanCrenshaw for joining me today in introducing the #NewParentsAct. We have put forth a responsible #PaidFamilyLeave policy that allows new parents flexibility to spend more time with their children. https://wagner.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/wagner-rubio-romney-crenshaw-introduce-bill-giving-parents-an-option-for …

Great visit to the St. Louis Fusion Center. Their important work ensures vital information that helps prevent and fight terrorism is responsibly shared with our local Law Enforcement, First Responders and Critical Infrastructure. pic.twitter.com/LmSmzcFlNs

Today is World Down Syndrome Day, and we celebrate the joy those with Down Syndrome bring to everyone around them. I’m so proud of Lily Crockett and her family for traveling to Iceland to spread that beautiful joy to others. pic.twitter.com/JxC8l3fyaw

Yesterday, the U.N. finally saw the light & increased Karadzic’s sentence to life in prison, a modicum of justice for the victims of the 1995 genocide & for the more than 70,000 Bosnians who fled from these injustices to Saint Louis.  @STLBosnians https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/20/world/europe/radovan-karadzic-bosnia-un-tribunal.html …
in which 8,000 Muslim men & boys were brutally murdered, & called for a sentence of life in prison instead of the outrageously lenient 40-year sentence he received.
Three years ago I stood with tens of thousands of Bosnians who had fled from the terrors of Radovan Karadzic, the former Bosnian Serb leader responsible for the 1995 Srebrenica massacre...

Our small businesses and entrepreneurs are the backbone of our local economies. Today for #SBDCDay we honor their innovation and recognize the many benefits small businesses have locally and around the nation. @MissouriSBDC

I was thrilled to meet with @ThriveStLouis President Bridget VanMeans and several team members to learn about their inspiring life-affirming work to help others in our community. pic.twitter.com/bROsyez0TL

Combating our nation’s opioid crisis is a top priority of mine in Congress. We all have a role to play to prevent this epidemic tearing through our community. At @DEASTLOUISDiv, their outreach, prevention, & enforcement efforts are crucial to stopping drug trafficking & violence. pic.twitter.com/EpBssWPsX6

I am excited to announce the official launch of the Suburban Caucus, which will push a forward-thinking agenda that empowers American families & solves problems that threaten household prosperity & reduce the quality of life for millions. Read more here: https://wagner.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/wagner-launches-suburban-caucus …
Thank you to CDIF for hosting this important event and I look forward to working with them to achieve amazing results that empower women and minorities.
Diversity and inclusion can bring a wealth of social and economic benefits to the workplace that will ultimately lift up businesses and employees.
We had a great conversation with the Corporate Diversity and Inclusion Forum about our shared efforts to promote diversity in the Financial Services sector. pic.twitter.com/V3gtezv1ec

Had the pleasure of speaking w/constituents from the @MOFarmBureau on the benefits of trade to our local agricultural community & how the USMCA will benefit STL's thriving ag-tech community by addressing agricultural biotechnology, including new technologies such as gene editing. pic.twitter.com/VDPTd3QKud

I enjoyed speaking to the @Heritage crowd before a viewing of “Unplanned.” This new film highlights the inspirational story of Abby Johnson, a former manager of a Planned Parenthood clinic who became a pro-life advocate after witnessing the horror of abortion. pic.twitter.com/PefP0fJC51

We are praying for the victims of the senseless act of terror in New Zealand. A place of worship should be full of peace, free from violence and terror. Attacks like this strike us all at our core. May God bless the victims and their families.

I also spoke on the House Floor in November expressing my dismay with the 8th short-term extension vote since FY17. With the NFIP being $20.5 billion in debt, we must reform the program to keep it solvent and provide coverage for those who truly need it.
I spoke at a @FinancialCmte hearing on the reauthorization of the National Flood Insurance Program which is set to expire yet again in May. https://youtu.be/IDpsZDNgvzA

Although it has recently made numerous corporate changes and has been fined millions of dollars, there is still more to be done to be certain that consumers are protected and can have faith they are placing their money in a trustworthy institution.
Wells Fargo betrayed the public’s trust and took advantage of customers in order to meet sales performance goals and fraudulently improve earnings and share prices.

This morning I questioned the CEO of Wells Fargo, Timothy Sloan, on the bank’s recent scandals and misconduct:  https://youtu.be/UxAn-CcOiVU 

As Vice Ranking Member on @FinancialCmte, one of my top priorities is making sure consumers are protected from corporate malfeasance.

Several of my colleagues and I reintroduced the Global Fragility Act that would focus America’s diplomatic, development, and security efforts on preventing the root causes of violence and instability in countries around the world. Read more here: https://wagner.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/bipartisan-group-of-lawmakers-introduces-legislation-to-prevent-conflict …

It is time Congress reigns in the unconstitutional power of the CFPB. I am confident that Director Kraninger will be a strong partner in our ongoing work to protect consumers from the regulatory overreach that has deprived them of necessary choices & access to financial products.

Protecting consumers is one of my most important missions on @FinancialCmte. This week I questioned the Director of the CFPB, Kathy Kraninger, on the overly burdensome regulations that the Bureau has inflicted on consumers. https://youtu.be/jOmrL9-NVck

Women & girls around the world deserve equal access to education. By passing the READ Act last Congress—a bill I was proud to cosponsor—we are ensuring that girls in developing countries have a better path to success. #InternationalWomensDay #IWD2019 pic.twitter.com/QbPwqAn8ze
We are working to provide increased opportunities & access to education for our nation’s students and I appreciated learning from our HBCU leaders who are on the frontlines of this important issue.

I joined my friend @RepBeatty, the Chairwoman of the Diversity & Inclusion Subcommittee, for a roundtable discussion with leaders from our country’s Historically Black Colleges & Universities (HBCUs) to discuss the many ways Congress can work to strengthen investments in HBCUs. pic.twitter.com/umWh4xbu3F

We must give law enforcement tools to fight human trafficking, and passage of Senator Onder’s bill out of committee is a strong step toward this important legislation becoming law. It will help prosecutors better fight online sex traffickers and protect victims.
Great news to hear the Missouri Senate unanimously passed a state-level version of FOSTA out of the Judiciary Committee today!

This week is National Consumer Protection Week and you can find helpful tools on how protect yourself from scams and safeguard your personal information here: https://www.consumer.ftc.gov/blog/2019/03/its-national-consumer-protection-week-2019?utm_source=govdelivery …
